{{also|异国}}
==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|い|こく|yomi=o}}
From {{etyl|zhx|ja|sort=いこく}} {{m|zh|異國}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|いこく|kyu=異國}}

# A foreign country; a foreign land; a country external to Japan.
#* 1603-1604: {{w|Nippo Jisho}} (page 329)
#*: '''Icocu'''. <small>イコク</small> Cotonaru cuni. (異なる国) 他の国、あるいは、外国人の国.
#* 1617: Gennabon {{w|Kagakushū}} (page 7)
#*: '''異國''' (イコク)

=====Usage notes=====
While synonymous with {{m|ja|外国|tr=gaikoku}}, this latter term is more common, while {{lang|ja|異国}} is a more formal term, suggesting “foreign lands, the exotic”.

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|異国人|いこくじん}}: a [[foreigner]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|外国|がいこく}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|こと|くに|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=ことくに}} {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ことくに|異|tr1=koto|t1=different, other|国|tr2=kuni|t2=country, land}}.

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|ことくに|kyu=異國}}

# A different land, a strange land.
# A foreign country.

=====Usage notes=====
Archaic.

=====Synonyms=====
* {{sense|different land}}
** {{ja-r|異郷|いきょう}}
** {{ja-r|他国|たこく}}, {{ja-r|他国|ひとくに}}
* {{sense|foreign country}}
** {{ja-r|外国|がいこく}}
** {{ja-r|異邦|いほう}}
